t: Amazon (company) - Wikipedia
s: 1 day ago - The company launched in 2005 in Dubai, United Arab Emirates and served multiple areas across the Middle East. On March 28, 2017, Amazon acquired Souq.com for $580 million. The company was re-branded as Amazon and its infrastructure was used to expand Amazon's online platform in the Middle East.

t: Amazon Counterfeit Crimes Unit (CCU) - Trustworthy Shopping at Amazon

t: How Amazon uses AI innovations to stop fraud and counterfeits
s: March 26, 2025 - More than 2.5 billion product units have been verified as genuine through Amazon's Transparency program, and it has enrolled 88,000 brands worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies, global brands, startups, and small businesses.

t: Amazon releases its first Brand Protection Report
s: May 10, 2021 - Amazon established its Counterfeit Crimes Unit to build and refer cases to law enforcement, undertake independent investigations or joint investigations with brands, and pursue civil litigation against counterfeiters.

t: Welcome to the Era of Fake Products | Wirecutter
s: March 25, 2020 - We bought our fake for $9.86 on Amazon, about $5 less than the price Joseph Enterprises set. We were even able to find obvious fakes selling for $2 apiece in bulk on Chinese commerce site Alibaba. Because there are rarely consequences for selling fakes, beyond a seller disappearing from a site, ...

t: Amazon.com - Report Infringement
